value.title: Tips, Gateway, Embedding and Analysis Services - Roundup #57
value.excerpt: There were a bunch of items I found this week. From tips for beginners, to some gateway updates and items for Analysis Services. I have a few bonus links down below that weren't included in the video.  Top 10 Tips for Getting Started with Power BI (@ExceleratorBI) http://exceleratorbi.com.au/top-10-tips-getting-started-power-bi/

value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can display multiple values within a tooltip for a visual. He walks through the DAX measure and also shows some pitfalls to look out for when it comes to filter context.  Go here for the sample DAX statement: https://guyinacube.com/2017/06/tooltips-tooltips-tooltips-power-bi/

value.title: Tracing Power BI with Fiddler
value.excerpt: I look at how you can use Fiddler to trace what is happening between your client machine and the Power BI Service.  This looks at the API's we use and what is returned.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1  LET'S CONNECT!  Blogs -- http://blogs.technet.com/powerbisupport

value.title: Tracing your DAX queries in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how you can trace your DAX queries when trying to troubleshoot or optimize Power BI reports and datasets. There are a few options and Adam walks you through them.  DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/  SQL Server Management Studio: https://docs.microsoft.com/sql/ssms/download-sql-server-management-studio-ssms?view=sql-server-ver15

value.title: Troubleshooting Gateway Performance
value.excerpt: I walk through what I know about troubleshooting gateway performance. This can be useful for Power BI, PowerApps, Microsoft Flow or Azure Logic Apps.  This includes two main areas.  1. Performance Counters 2. Tracking query duration within the gateway logs.  Hopefully, this will help you dig into what

value.title: Understanding the TIMELINE in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: We brought Marco in to help explain the TIMELINE update within DAX Studio. This can help you understand performance a bit deeper when optimizing your DAX and models. This is one to watch!  DAX Studio https://daxstudio.org  Marco Russo https://twitter.com/marcorus https://www.linkedin.com/in/sqlbi/ https://sqlbi.com

value.title: Upcoming EdX course on Analysis Services Tabular w/ Peter Myers (DAT225X)
value.excerpt: I met up with Peter Myers to talk about an upcoming EdX course for Analysis Services Tabular. He wrote and primarily presented the course which is free to you. You also have the option to upgrade to get a certificate of completion if you wish.  The course will be released on March 14, 2017 and is DAT225X.

value.title: Use other tools with the Power BI data model
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at other tools you can use against the Power BI Desktop diagnostic port besides DAX Studio. From clearing the model cache, to getting other information, this is a handy way to look at your Power BI Desktop file.  PowerShell - Get Diagnostic Port - https://gist.github.com/guyinacube/af42d725bc329d54f2c2480a61e8bf98

value.excerpt: Wil Reynolds asked an awesome question about how to use multiple URLs with the web from example Power BI feature. The magic is with Power Query functions and parameters. value.title: Use the Power BI Rebind API to move from cached to Azure AS
value.excerpt: The Power BI Rebind API allows you to change the dataset of a report. Patrick shows how you can use the Power BI Rebind API to move from a cached dataset to a live connection on Azure Analysis Services.  PowerShell examples - https://github.com/Azure-Samples/powerbi-powershell  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in

value.title: Using Azure SQL Database Failover with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how you can easily use Azure SQL Database Failover Groups with Power BI to ensure you have access to your data. Connecting to an Azure SQL Database Failover Group from Power BI is easier than connecting to a secondary replica of an Always On Availability Group.  LET'S

value.title: Using Custom Format Strings in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how to use custom format strings in Power BI Desktop. From dates and time to numbers, he calls out some things to look out for. value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Using Microsoft Flow and Power BI to help teachers
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how to use Power BI and Microsoft Flow to track attendance in the classroom. This is an idea to help spark your imagination for what is possible with Microsoft technologies.   Patrick talks about using expressions in Microsoft Flow. For more information on using expressions,

value.title: Using OneDrive for Business with Power BI
value.excerpt: Sharon asked a question about how to get started with OneDrive for Business and then use that with Power BI. value.excerpt: Are your Power BI Aggregations not matching? Setting Precedence can control which Power BI aggregation will be preferred. A little hint to help it on its way! value.title: Week long training...
value.excerpt: Last week I was up in the Seattle area for training with my team. It is called the boot camp event. This was the 2nd year we have done it.   This was a week long training encompassing things from SEO to development to Power BI. I focused mostly on Git and GitHub during this time.  The event ended with
